sub_title: Founder | Keynote Speaker | Climate Careers | Innovation | Sustainable Development | Policy and International Cooperation
summary:
I am currently working as Partnerships and Outreach Manager at Climate KIC (Strategic Programmes), the largest public-private partnership to foster climate innovation in Europe. In 2018, I founded Youth Climate Leaders, an organization that fosters climate action and careers by training and connecting young people with networks and opportunities to start their careers as climate leaders. I am also a member of the Regional Coordinating Committee (LatAm), UNDRR’s MCR2030 initiative: cities and climate change, and Professor of Sustainable Development Policies at the Burgundy School of Business. I have experience working on sustainable development and international cooperation in the public, private and third sectors. Previously, I have served as Deputy Executive Coordinator at the Brazilian Forum on Climate Change, and I worked as a consultant at CIVICUS, UNDP, and the UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network (SDSN). I hold an MPA in Development Practice degree from Columbia University.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
LANGUAGES: Portuguese, English, Spanish and French
EXPERTISE: Sustainable Development, Climate Change, Innovation, Partnerships, Entrepreneurship, Economics, International Cooperation, Climate Policy, Education, Sustainable Cities 
INTERNATIONAL EXPERIENCE: Visited 34 countries across 4 continents; lived in Brazil, USA, Portugal, and the Netherlands.
OTHER: Raised $40,000 in one month with the private sector to pay for Master’s; Member of the Brazilian Delegation to COP20, COP21, COP22, COP23, COP24 and COP25; Attended Rio+20 and UNGA 2014, 2015, 2018 and 2019.

LEADERSHIP POSITIONS
• Member, Regional Coordinating Committee (LatAm), UNDRR’s MCR2030 initiative: cities and climate change (2021)
• Ambassador and Institutional Partner of Planetiers and the Planetiers World Gathering (2020-2021)
• Coordinator, Brazilian Climate Center (CBC) - including the “Governors for the climate” initiative (2019-2020)
• Member of the Lemann Fellows Advisory Board, Columbia Global Centers Rio de Janeiro (2018-2019)
• Member of Advisory Board on climate change to the President of Brazil (2018)
• Attended a private meeting with President Obama and other 10 young people (2017): official video
• Global Shaper Sao Paulo, World Economic Forum (2017-2018)
• Member of Experts Network, International Centre for Trade and Sustainable Development (2016) 
• Global Urban Development Fellow, GUD (2015)
• President, Columbia University Coalition for Sustainable Development (2013 - 2014) 
• On-the-Ground Rio+20 Organizer, Road to Rio+20 - Peace Child International (2012)

awards.issuer: Institute for Global Prosperity, University College London

awards.title: Member of #NextGen Consortium Advisory Council
awards.description:
The NextGen Consortium is a multi-year, multi-industry global consortium that aims to advance the design, commercialization, and recovery of food packaging alternatives. It does this through four work streams:
● Innovation (Cup Challenge, Pilots, and
Accelerator)
● Infrastructure
● Value Chain Influencers
● Consumer Engagement
The Consortium works across the value chain – with brands, municipalities, material recovery facilities, and manufacturers – to ensure we identify viable market solutions that get through the supply chain and bring value to the recovery system globally.

awards.title: Member of Advisory Board on climate change to the President of Brazil
2018 UNLEASH Talent - Climate Action (SDG 13)
awards.description:
UNLEASH picks talents based on five criteria:

1. Demonstrated commitment to solving some of the world’s pressing challenges
2. Possession of a creative and innovative mindset
3. Proven track record of making contributions to solving social causes
4. Willingness to engage in co-creation with peers and experts
5. High proficiency in English with the ability to engage in complex discussions

profile_positions.location: Amesterdão, Holanda do Norte, Países Baixos
profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for attracting new partners, exploring opportunities of growth and funding, and developing new programs at Europe’s largest public-private partnership focused on innovation to mitigate and adapt to climate change
• Support with policy projects, such as the Transatlantic Innovation Platform (MoU signed with the government of California) and participating in global events, such as COP27 and the UN Mayors Forum (Geneva). 
• Program Manager for Climathons (an international movement to engage cities and citizens worldwide in climate action) in Latin America, coordinating activities in 8 countries.
• Responsible to review Climate-KIC's strategy for alumni relations, organizing local and global events, and scouting opportunities for Climate-KIC's alumni community.
• (2022) Mentor to the Amazon Launchpad startups (UK), jury to the final event of the Climate Launchpad, and facilitator of Circular Economy Business Model Innovation workshops for SMEs and startups (Slovenia)
• (2022) Co-lead of the Young Innovators program, targeting secondary school students and educators
profile_positions.title: Partnerships and Outreach Manager, Strategic Programmes

profile_positions.description:
Youth Climate Leaders (YCL) catalyzes climate action by providing youth with training, networks and concrete opportunities to start their careers in the field of climate change. Although we represent the largest percentage of the world’s population, youth continue to face great barriers to secure gainful employment and economic security, while facing uncertain futures with mounting externalities from the climate crisis. Therefore, YCL offers unique pathways to equip young people with the tools needed to engage in the new climate economy. This includes immersive learning journeys, where participants develop an understanding of climate change in theory and in practice through hands-on work with climate solutions. And a Global Network present in more than 20 countries, and access to  professional development opportunities.

• Hosted eight learning journeys and four YCL Delegations in eight countries
• Manages the YCL Network, with 700+ members from more than 20 countries and four continents 
• Coordinates a team present in 5 countries, including YCL staff (volunteer and paid) and staff from partner organizations
• Leads sales, partnerships and fundraising activities, liaising with more than 100 partners worldwide
• Coordinated consultancy projects through the YCL Network & Consulting initiative, developing reports trainings and stakeholder analysis for organizations such as GIZ, Politica por Inteiro and Trias Brasil.

www.youthclimateleaders.org
profile_positions.title: Founder and CEO

profile_positions.description:
- Course: Sustainable Development Policies (30h) at the Green Tech and Sustainable Societies MSc (GTSS)
- Classes topics include:
* History of Sustainable Development
* International Relations Theory Applied to Sustainable Development
* From Global to Local, from public to private: Who are the main actors on SD policy?
* A Green New Deal: different pathways for a common goal
* Our House is on Fire: What does the science say about climate change?
* Traveling back home: How to implement global agreements domestically?
* Circular Economy
* Climate negotiations, economics, decarbonization pathways and emerging solutions.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description: After the Brazilian Forum on Climate Change changed its leadership in May 2019, I continued working with Alfredo Sirkis and his team to implement the agenda of his mandate in the regional and local levels as Networks & Fundraising Coordinator for his think tank Centro Brasil no Clima (May 2019-December 2020). Activities included the launch of the “Governors for the climate” initiative, which currently engages 22 Brazilian states.
profile_positions.title: Networks & Fundraising Coordinator

company.name: Fórum Brasileiro de Mudança do Clima

profile_positions.company: Fórum Brasileiro de Mudança do Clima
profile_positions.description:
• Led the multi-stakeholder draft of recommendations for the Brazilian Long-Term Strategy (LTS) for the UNFCCC
• Facilitated the compilation of thematic recommendations into an integrated strategy for the implementation of the Brazilian NDC, which was submitted to the Brazilian President, Ministries and shared with civil society 
• Coordinated multi-stakeholder engagement in four of the Forum's Thematic Chambers: (1) Agriculture, Biodiversity and Forests; (2) Climate Finance; (3) Long-Term Vision; and (4) Science, Technology and Innovation
• Engaged with representatives from more than 13 Brazilian states and several cities

(Started as Engagement Lead, assuming the position of Deputy Executive Coordinator in December 2018)
profile_positions.title: Deputy Executive Coordinator

company.name: CIVICUS: World Alliance for Citizen Participation

profile_positions.location: New York, United States / Sao Paulo, Brazil
profile_positions.company: CIVICUS: World Alliance for Citizen Participation
profile_positions.description:
• Facilitated innovation projects such as the DataShift Challenge and A4SD's Innovative Solutions Working Group
• Fostered the strategic direction and implementation of CIVICUS’ sustainable development initiatives, including efforts to coordinate civil society engagement on Agenda 2030 and climate change processes
• Focal point of the DataShift initiative in the UN and New York, promoting the use of citizen-generated data in the monitoring and accountability of the Sustainable Development Goals
• Coordinated the exchange of knowledge between several CIVICUS projects related to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), such as SDG monitoring, global and national engagement of civil society, civic space and partnerships
• Represented CIVICUS in global policy events and sustainable development networks
profile_positions.title: Sustainable Development Officer

profile_positions.location: Cidade de Nova Iorque e Região, Estados Unidos
profile_positions.description:
• Developed scenarios on how changes in precipitation and temperature patterns are likely to affect traditional crops and smallholder farmers in the North and Northeast of Brazil.
• Presented alternative options of crops and potential economic activities tailored to different biomes (semiarid, agreste, cerrado and Amazon rainforest). 
• Explored the feasibility of adopting innovative technologies and management practices on different climate change scenarios anticipated for the region.
• Provided recommendations of policies and regulations, financing options, and climate change adaptation and mitigation practices to achieve sustainable agricultural pathways in the region.
profile_positions.title: Consultant – Climate change impacts on smallholder farmers in the North and Northeast of Brazil

profile_positions.location: Cidade de Nova Iorque e Região, Estados Unidos
profile_positions.description:
• Supported the launch of the Brazil SDSN by organizing events with invitees from Brazilian governmental agencies, academia, private sector and the United Nations and by establishing partnerships with Brazilian organizations (private, public, NGOs and academia). 
• Developed research and reports on climate change scenarios for the Amazon.
• Interacted with riverine entrepreneurs working with food products. 
• Developed a stakeholder portfolio with up to 100 organizations located at the Amazon Basin’s countries for the Amazon SDSN.
• Worked as Teaching Assistant to Professor Jeffrey Sachs’ “The Age of Sustainable Development” (Fall 2014) online course.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Assistant

company.name: Columbia University Coalition for Sustainable Development (CUCSD)

profile_positions.location: Cidade de Nova Iorque e Região, Estados Unidos
profile_positions.company: Columbia University Coalition for Sustainable Development (CUCSD)
profile_positions.description:
Constituted in 2012, the Columbia Coalition for Sustainable Development (CUCSD) is a student-led organization created to provide the Columbia University community with the opportunity to engage in sustainable development-related conversations around the world. With the aim of increasing sustainability awareness and sustainable development impact, our members represent the broader university community by sharing their work with field experts, participating in multilateral negotiations, mobilizing their peers in impacting international policies, and applying their experience in their academic and professional work.


- General Coordinator: CUCSD Delegation to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change's COP20
- Organized different panels, academic and social events 
- Followed-up different UN environmental processes, such as the post-2015 development agenda, the Sustainable Development Goas (SDGs) and climate negotiations.
profile_positions.title: President

company.name: Permanent Mission of Brazil to the United Nations

profile_positions.company: Permanent Mission of Brazil to the United Nations
profile_positions.description:
- Support to the Permanent Mission of Brazil to the United Nations in New York (DELBRASONU) on internal activities and activities held in the UN.
- Support to the Brazilian delegation at UN meetings and development of research on topics related to environmental issues.
- Development of supporting material for internal meetings with Brazilian delegates or guests from other delegations, international organizations and non-governmental organizations.
- Participation in weekly seminars on the major subjects of Brazilian foreign policy, taught by the diplomat in charge of the area studied.
profile_positions.title: Advisor on Sustainable Development

volunteer_experiences.role: Member, Regional Coordinating Committee (LatAm) - UNDRR's MCR2030 initiative

company.name: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR)

volunteer_experiences.description:
About Making Cities Resilient 2030 (MCR2030)

Is your city resilient? Does its resilience help its citizens to prosper and flourish? Join other cities on a pathway to resilience – making the city safer, preventing risks and promoting innovation and investments. 

Making Cities Resilient 2030 (MCR2030) is a unique cross-stakeholder initiative for improving local resilience through advocacy, sharing knowledge and experiences, establishing mutually reinforcing city-to-city learning networks, injecting technical expertise, connecting multiple layers of government and building partnerships. 

Through delivering a clear 3-stage roadmap to urban resilience, providing tools, access to knowledge and monitoring and reporting tools, MCR2030 will support cities on their journey to reduce risk and build resilience. 

https://mcr2030.undrr.org/

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Lemann Fellows Advisory Board | Columbia Global Centers Rio de Janeiro

company.name: UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network – Youth

volunteer_experiences.description:
Rio+Veg was a coalition of over 30 NGOs focused on discussing the environmental impact of meat consumption and production during Rio+20. 

- Organization of 24 activities during Rio+20, both in the official conference and civil society’s events (e.g. People’s Summit, MGCY Youth Blast, etc.). From these activities, is worth highlighting the lecture I gave during the Rio+20 Conference for Youth Breakfast, organized by the World Bank, and my participation in the Rio+20 Hangout with Mr. Brice Lalonde - Executive Coordinator for the Rio+20 Conference.

- Discussion of relevant issues with international and national policy makers, such as Marina Silva (Former Minister of Environment), Fabio Feldmann (Environmentalist and Former Congressmen), Carlos Minc (Former Minister of Environment), Achim Steiner – Executive Director of UNEP (United Nations Environment Programme) – e Nick Nuttall – (Acting Director of DCPI-UNEP).
 
- Publication of more than 20 articles on issues related to the Conference.
